biography.bio: His family left Cluj when it was ceded to Hungary in 1940, and moved to Cernauti after the city's occupation by Romania the following year. There, his father was appointed to the role of chief municipal veterinary. Later they returned home, and Florin graduated from the High School for Boys No. 3 in Cluj. Piersic attended the Caragiale Academy of Theatrical Arts and Cinematography in Bucharest. He joined the regular cast of the Romanian National Theater at 1959 and performed in numerous productions until his retirement in 1989. His first role was as Richard in The Devil's Disciple. In 1958 he made his debut on screen in the French-Romanian co-production The Thistles of the Baragan. He appeared in more than forty movies, most of them in the Ceausescu era. He often depicted heroic, masculine characters. More recently, he played in a soap opera. Piersic married thrice: to Tatiana Iekel (their marriage lasted from 1962 to 1974), with whom he had a son, Florin Jr.; To Anna Szeles (1975-1985), the mother of another son, Daniel; and from 1993, he is married to Anna Torok. Im 2006, he was voted to the 51st place on the 100 greatest Romanians list. At 2008 he became an honorary citizen of Oradea. In 2009, he was bestowed with the lifetime achievement award in the Transilvania International Film Festival.
biography.name: Florin Piersic

biography.bio: Marga Barbu was born on February 24, 1929 in Ocna Sugatag, Maramures, Romania. She was an actress, known for Drumul oaselor (1982), Haiducii lui Saptecai (1971) and Haiducii (1966). She was married to Eugen Barbu. She died on March 31, 2009 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Marga Barbu

biography.bio: Stuntman, actor and film director Szabolcs Imre Cseh was born in Miercurea Ciuc and grew up in the city of Brasov. He graduated from the Bucharest's Institute of Physical Education and Sport in 1966. In the same year he was hired as fight advisor at Buftea Film Production Center. Between 1966 and 1979 he worked on almost all films made by the studios that contained sequences of action-fighting, and performed the hardest stunts, some of them being world records at the time. Cseh collaborated on the making of more than 150 feature and TV films, of which 25 were foreign productions. In 1990, Szabolcs Imre Cseh founded the first association of professional stuntmen in Romania, which he led for many years. He also taught acting classes at the Romanian National University of Theatre and Film (from 1979). Between 2005 and 2014 he led a sports association for children who have problems related to integration into society (The "Gladiator" Association). President Traian Basescu posthumously awarded on him the "Star of Romania" National Order in the rank of Knight. He was also decorated in 2010 with the "Faithful Service" National Order in the rank of Knight.
biography.name: Szabolcs Cseh

biography.bio: George Motoi was born on January 22, 1936 in Arman, Caliacra, Bulgaria. He was an actor, known for Întoarcerea lui Voda Lapusneanu (1980), Trandafirul galben (1982) and Adela (1985). He was married to Giliola and Cezara Dafinescu. He died on March 4, 2015 in Romania.
biography.name: George Motoi

biography.bio: Emil Hossu was born on November 24, 1941 in Ocna Sibiului, Romania. He was an actor, known for The Secret of Bacchus (1984), Sosesc pasarile calatoare (1984) and Vara sentimentala (1985). He was married to Catrinel Dumitrescu. He died on January 25, 2012 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Emil Hossu

biography.bio: George Constantin was born on May 3, 1933 in Bucharest, Romania. He was an actor, known for Reconstruction (1968), An Unforgettable Summer (1994) and Burebista (1980). He died on April 30, 1994.
biography.name: George Constantin

biography.bio: Mircea Albulescu was born on October 4, 1934 in Bucharest, Romania as Iorgu Constantin Albulescu. He was an actor, known for Actorul si salbaticii (1975), Michael the Brave (1970) and For Motherland (1977). He was married to Maria. He died on April 8, 2016 in Bucharest.
biography.name: Mircea Albulescu

biography.bio: Ion Besoiu was born on March 11, 1931 in Sibiu, Sibiu, Romania. He was an actor, known for Michael the Brave (1970), Bucharest Non Stop (2015) and Toate pînzele sus (1976). He died on January 18, 2017 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Ion Besoiu

biography.bio: Constantin Codrescu was born on September 5, 1931 in Husi, Falciu, Romania. He is an actor, known for Le moulin de la chance (1957), Train of Life (1998) and Michael the Brave (1970).
biography.name: Constantin Codrescu

biography.bio: Stelian Stancu is an actor, known for The Convoy (1981), Ultima frontiera a mortii (1979) and Totul se plateste (1987).
biography.name: Stelian Stancu

biography.bio: Eugenia Bosânceanu was born on February 8, 1925 in Radauti-Prut, Romania. She is an actress, known for 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days (2007), L'occident (2002) and Médaille d'honneur (2009).
biography.name: Eugenia Bosânceanu

biography.bio: Constantin Dinulescu was born on March 19, 1933 in Alexandria, Romania. He is an actor, known for Train of Life (1998), A unsprezecea porunca (1991) and Misterele Bucurestilor (1983).
biography.name: Constantin Dinulescu

biography.bio: Dorina Done is an actress, known for Doua lozuri (1957), Bumerangul (1974) and Campioana (1990).
biography.name: Dorina Done

biography.bio: Radu Dunareanu was born on June 3, 1926 in Galati, Romania. He was an actor, known for Forest of the Hanged (1965), Meandre (1966) and Falansterul (1979). He died on March 23, 2006 in Bucuresti, Romania.
biography.name: Radu Dunareanu

biography.bio: Cornel Elefterescu is an actor, known for Burebista (1980) and Totul se plateste (1987).
biography.name: Cornel Elefterescu
